title: Air Canada offre 32,5 % Ã  ses agents de bord pour Ã©viter la grÃ¨ve
text:
Air Canada offre 32,5 % Ã  ses agents de bord pour Ã©viter la grÃ¨ve
Air Canada vient de mettre sur la table une augmentation de salaire globale de 32,5 % sur quatre ans Ã  ses agents de bord afin dâ€™Ã©viter une grÃ¨ve.
Le transporteur aÃ©rien augmenterait dÃ¨s la premiÃ¨re annÃ©e la rÃ©munÃ©ration totale, incluant les avantages sociaux et les primes, d'environ 20 %, rapporte lâ€™agence Bloomberg.
Comme demandÃ© par le syndicat, Air Canada accepterait aussi de rÃ©munÃ©rer les agents de bord pour une partie du temps passÃ© au sol.
Mardi matin, le syndicat annonÃ§ait que les 10 000 membres du personnel des agents de bord dâ€™Air Canada avaient votÃ© Ã  99,7% en faveur de la grÃ¨ve.
Cet arrÃªt de travail pourrait Ãªtre effectif Ã  partir du 16 aoÃ»t ce qui inquiÃ¨te les utilisateurs puisque la compagnie aÃ©rienne pourrait Ãªtre forcÃ©e de rÃ©duire ses opÃ©rations et mÃªme d'annuler des vols quelques jours avant cette date.
La prÃ©sidente du syndicat Natasha Stea affirmait sur les ondes de LCN mardi que son groupe avait bon espoir dâ€™en venir Ã  une entente avant le 16 aoÃ»t ce qui Ã©viterait Ã  des centaines de milliers de voyageurs de bousiller leurs plans.
Air Canada effectue prÃ¨s de 700 vols par jour pour environ 130 000 passagers.

author: Molly Schramm
title: Top 9 restaurants serving soup in the Tri-State
text: CINCINNATI â€” There's one word for the weather lately: cold. Winter is in full swing around the Tri-State, which means its the perfect time to indulge in a warm cup or bowl of soup. Whether you love classic chicken noodle or you want to try something more adventurous, there are plenty of solid soup options around the Tri-State. Here are the Top 9 restaurants or delis serving up some scrumptious soup: Silverglades Delicatessen Serving up delicious food in Cincinnati for more than 100 years, [Silverglades Delicatessen](https://silvergladesdeli.com/) is a one-stop shop for soup, sandwiches, salads and more. In terms of soup, customers can choose between two homemade options, which rotate daily. The soups can be ordered in either a 12-ounce cup or 16-ounce bowl. Some previous soup options include butternut squash, stuffed pepper, vegetable and more. Silverglades is open Monday through Friday from 7:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. The Block Deli Located in Crescent Springs, [The Block Deli](https://www.theblockdeli.net/) offers both dine-in and carry-out options Mondays through Saturdays. The deli offers a different homemade soup each day its open, and on Thursdays, The Block Deli makes a different "customer favorite" soup. Some soup options include turkey wild rice, chicken gumbo, bean, baja chicken and more. Soups can come in either a cup or bowl, and can also be topped with cheese and bacon. La Soupe [According to its website](https://www.lasoupe.org/), La Soupe "bridges the gap between food waste and hunger." La Soupe rescues perishables to make its soups, which are then distributed to roughly 150 partners to food those who are food insecure. Outside of its distribution work, La Soupe also offers carry-out soups, many of which are frozen and can be enjoyed whenever, from its Walnut Hills kitchen. La Soupe has various options, including lobster bisque, cheesy broccoli, chicken noodle and more. Pho Lang Thang Over-the-Rhine's [Pho Lang Thang](https://www.pholangthang.com/) is the quintessential place to enjoy a warm bowl of pho. The Vietnamese soup includes broth, noodles and thins slices of a meat of choice, and it's served with bean sprouts, herbs, limes and other garnishes on the side. The restaurant, which is located at by Findlay Market, also serves banh mi and other Vietnamese options to eat alongside your pho. Pho Lang Thang is open Tuesday through Saturday from 11 a.m. to 10 p.m and Sunday from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. Silver Ladle Located in downtown Cincinnati, [Silver Ladle](https://www.silverladle.com/) specializes in all things soup. With 10 different soup options, there's something for everyone at Silver Ladle. For those wanting something hearty, they can opt for the Loaded Baked Potato soup topped with chopped bacon and cheddar-jack cheese. Those wanting something lighter, they could go with the tomato basil. Soups come in either a cup, bowl or quart, with prices ranging from $4.39 to $13.59 depending on the soup and size. Silver Ladle is open from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Monday through Friday. Mazunte All three of [Mazunte](https://mazuntetacos.com/)'s locations â€” the two in Madisonville and downtown â€” are the perfect place to get a hearty bowl of pozole. The traditional Mexican soup includes hominy, pork, chicken, vegetables and tostados on the side. Mazunte's downtown location serves pozole verde, which has chicken, hominy, onion, cilantro, cabbage, radish, avocado and lime. You can [click here](https://mazuntetacos.com/) to view the hours for Mazunte's three locations. Kremer's Market [Kremer's Market](https://kremersmarket.com/) is a family-owned grocer that's been in Northern Kentucky since 1977, but its also makes delicious lunch specials, including rotating soups. Each day of the week, Kremer's offers a different soup, which are all made in-house. Some options include cream of potato, wild mushroom beef barley, chicken wild rice, black bean chorizo and more. Kremer's is open Monday through Saturday from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. and Sunday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Red Fox Grill [Red Fox Grill](https://redfoxgrill.com/) has been in a staple in downtown Cincinnati since 1965. The restaurant serves breakfast and lunch daily, including homemade soups, that's made in-house daily. Previous soup choices include tomato, chicken noodle, beef barley and more. No matter if you're dining in or getting carry out, Red Fox, which only accepts cash, offers the daily soup for $4. Red Fox Grill is open Monday through Friday from 10 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Fortune Noodle House - Clifton Specializing in hand-pulled noodles, [Fortune Noodle House](https://www.fortunenoodleuc.com/rs/index_home.action?pageType=D) is a great place to go for homemade soup. The Clifton restaurant has options, such as bok choy vegetable soup, vegetable soup with pork or chicken noodle soup. The restaurant also has traditional Asian soups like hot and sour soup, egg drop soup and more to choose from as well. Fortune Noodle House is open Monday through Saturday from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m.

author: @AleteiaEN
title: Pope expresses closeness to those affected by fire in Spain
text: Pope Francis assured his â€œspiritual closenessâ€ to all those affected by the â€œterrible fireâ€ that destroyed an apartment building in Valencia (Spain) on February 22, 2024. In a [telegram ](https://press.vatican.va/content/salastampa/it/bollettino/pubblico/2024/02/23/0163/00338.html)sent by the Vatican on February 23, the Pontiff encouraged firefightersâ€™ and rescue workersâ€™ efforts. The death toll has risen to nine [people ](https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-europe-68378338?ns_mchannel=social&ns_source=twitter&ns_campaign=bbc_live&ns_linkname=65d8c06257c60b5283ad3589%26Death%20toll%20rises%20to%2010%20-%20mayor%262024-02-23T15%3A57%3A37.999Z&ns_fee=0&pinned_post_locator=urn:asset:25f87b7e-b987-4f7e-bc59-b22eea63d91b&pinned_post_asset_id=65d8c06257c60b5283ad3589&pinned_post_type=share)so far. â€œThe Holy Father is closely following the news,â€ said the telegram, signed by the Cardinal Secretary of State, Pietro Parolin. â€œWhile commending the souls of the deceased to divine mercy, [the Pope] assures the people of Valencia and all the families of those affected of his spiritual closeness, and prays to the Lord to grant them strength in this moment of pain.â€ In the telegram, addressed to the Archbishop of Valencia, Enrique Benavent Vidal, the Pontiff also invoked the intercession of [Our Lady of the Forsaken](/2018/10/28/was-this-statue-of-our-lady-made-by-angels/) and her husband St. Joseph, the [two patron saints of the city](/2021/12/28/discover-the-devotion-to-our-lady-linked-to-the-holy-innocents/), to help the victims and rescue workers. He also sent his apostolic blessing to all the inhabitants of Valencia. On Thursday evening, a fire broke out in an apartment high-rise in a residential area of the city. The entire building was quickly engulfed in flames due to strong winds, and firefighters worked throughout the night. Some reports are indicating that the cladding on the building may have been highly flammable and contributed to the fire spreading so quickly. The official death toll is at nine people (earlier reports said 10), with 14 injured (including 6 firefighters) and around 14 still missing. Among the dead is a family, including the mom and dad, a toddler and a newborn.

author: Jason Benskin
title: Appleâ€™s Foray into High-End Mac Gaming | by Jason Benskin | Dec, 2023 | Level Up Coding
text: Appleâ€™s Foray into High-End Mac Gaming A Glimpse into the Future Introduction: In recent years, Apple has made significant strides in redefining its role in the gaming industry. Historically, Mac computers were not considered the go-to choice for serious gamers, with Windows-based PCs dominating the market. However, recent developments suggest that Apple is gearing up to change this narrative. Rumors and industry speculation point to Appleâ€™s intentions to enter the high-end gaming arena with a focus on Mac devices, signaling a potentially transformative shift in the world of Mac gaming. The Current State of Mac Gaming: While Macs have long been favored for their sleek design, user-friendly interface, and robust hardware, the gaming capabilities of these devices have often taken a backseat. Windows PCs have been the preferred choice for gamers, owing to their compatibility with a wider range of games and superior graphics performance. However, Apple has been gradually working to bridge this gap, introducing features like Metal graphics API and supporting technologies like eGPUs to enhance gaming experiences on Mac. Rumors and speculations: Recent reports and industry insiders suggest that Apple is now eyeing the high-end gaming market with a dedicated focus on Mac devices. Speculations point to the company developing a new line of Macs designed specifically for gaming, with hardware configurations that rival or even surpass those of traditional gaming PCs. This move is seen as a strategic response to the growing demand for high-performance gaming experiences on the Mac platform.

author: Joseph Draper; PA
title: Off-road drivers were swept away by river, says man who tried to save them â€“ The Irish News
text: A man who tried to save three men trapped in a submerged 4Ã—4 vehicle said they were â€œswept awayâ€ as they attempted to cross a river. Emergency services including police, ambulance and a helicopter attended a location on the River Esk near Glaisdale shortly before midday on Thursday. A 4Ã—4 was recovered from the river by the fire service just after 3pm and three men found inside had died, North Yorkshire Police said. Chris Ford, who lives nearby, told the PA news agency the men were part of an off-roading group when they crossed a ford on Rake Lane. The river, swollen by heavy rain, swept them away and carried them around 400 yards downstream, he said. Emergency services have been dealing with a serious incident on Thursday (28 December) involving a 4Ã—4 vehicle in the River Esk near Glaisdale on the North York Moors ðŸš¨ Three men sadly died at the scene. More information is available here â¬‡ï¸ [https://t.co/KgxPhHATO4] [pic.twitter.com/AvDT3TiqCk] â€” North Yorkshire Police (@NYorksPolice) [December 28, 2023] It came as Storm Gerrit caused flooding and travel chaos across the country throughout Wednesday and Thursday. Mr Ford, a firewood salesman, was called to the scene to help recover the vehicle with his tractor and found it fully submerged beneath the water, he said. He and two others used tractors to pull the 4Ã—4 on to the riverbank, he said. Police said another man, who attempted to help those trapped in the car, was pulled from the river and needed medical treatment. Mr Ford told PA: â€œThere was a ford they were going over and they were swept down 400 yards. â€œThey were part of an off-road club. â€œI went down with my tractor. There was a couple of vehicles â€“ one parked up. â€œYou couldnâ€™t see the (other) vehicle. It was 3ft beneath the water. â€œI helped get it out on to the riverbank with three other tractors.â€ Two other locals, Rosie and Andrew Dale, said they were with Mr Ford when he got the call to help. They said they saw several 4Ã—4 vehicles pass their home in the direction of the ford shortly before the incident. Mrs Dale said â€œnobody localâ€ would attempt to cross the ford in the current conditions. The area is popular with 4Ã—4 drivers, she said, adding: â€œIn the summer you get 10 of them at a time.â€ A spokesperson for North Yorkshire Police said: â€œLocalised conditions across our area are making driving hazardous. â€œRoads are particularly badly affected around the River Esk, to the north of the county, as we have seen with the tragic incident near Glaisdale. â€œThere was another incident at nearby Houlsyke at 12.49pm when a car got stuck in flood water and another at Kirby Wiske in Hambleton at 2.35pm. â€œThankfully, the occupants of both vehicles were brought to safety. â€œThe key advice is to consider whether your journey is necessary. â€œPlease avoid driving through any kind of standing or moving flood water if you possibly can.â€ Witnesses to the incident at Glaisdale are urged to call North Yorkshire Police on 101, option 4, quoting reference NYP-28122023-0146.

title: Lee sheriff: Narcotics operation nets 52 arrests, 24 firearms

author: Michael Kadlick Sports Illustrated
title: Victor Wembanyama Was a Highlight Machine in Front of Paris Crowd
text:
Sports
Victor Wembanyama Was a Highlight Machine in Front of Paris Crowd
In the first of two contests between the San Antonio Spurs and the Indiana Pacers for the NBA Paris Games 2025, it was-of course-France native Victor Wembanyama who stole the show.
To go along with a 140-110 win, the 7'3" 21-year-old center was a highlight reel machine. In 32 minutes of play, Wembanyama pulled off a self-alley-oop from just inside the free-throw line, dished out another to his teammate Jeremy Sochan, played lock-down defense, and was the Spurs' leading scorer on the afternoon.
Here's a look at some of the best moments from his performance:
WEMBY OFF THE GLASS TO HIMSELF
- NBA (@NBA)
Putting on a show in his home country[pic.twitter.com/wEEwDpzVkM][January 23, 2025]
this sequence at the end of the third. he checks every box.
- Rob Perez (@WorldWideWob)[pic.twitter.com/tucMFgZWIy][January 23, 2025]
Wembanyama finished San Antonio's win over Indiana with 30 points on 13-for-21 shooting, 11 rebounds, six assists, five blocks, and one steal.
Not too shabby.
The Spurs and Pacers conclude the 2025 Paris Games on Saturday from France's Accor Arena. Tip-off is scheduled for noon EST with the game airing on ESPN.
More of the Latest Around the NBA
This article was originally published on www.si.com as Victor Wembanyama Was a Highlight Machine in Front of Paris Crowd.

author: India McCarty
title: Will This Change Really 'Restore Free Expression' on Meta?
text:
Photo by Dima Solomin Will This Change Really â€˜Restore Free Expressionâ€™ on Meta? By MovieguideÂ® Contributor
Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg recently announced that the platform is getting rid of its fact-checking program in a bid to â€œrestore free expressionâ€ to social media sites like Instagram and Facebook.
In a video, Zuckerberg expressed disappointment that â€œgovernments and legacy media have pushed to censor more and more.â€
â€œAfter Trump first got elected in 2016 the legacy media wrote nonstop about how misinformation was a threat to democracy,â€ he explained . â€œWe tried in good faith to address these concerns without becoming the arbiters of truth. But fact-checkers have just been too politically biased and have destroyed more trust than they created, especially in the U.S.â€
Zuckerberg continued, â€œWeâ€™ve reached a point where itâ€™s just too many mistakes and too much censorship. The recent elections also feel like a cultural tipping point towards, once again, prioritizing speech. So weâ€™re gonna get back to our roots and focus on reducing mistakes, simplifying our policies and restoring free expression on our platforms.â€
Instead, Meta plans to implement â€œa community-driven system similar to Xâ€™s Community Notes,â€ per NBC News.
Elsewhere in the video, Zuckerberg revealed the company will â€œeliminate some content policies around immigration, gender and other hot-button issues and refocus its automated moderation systems onâ€¦â€˜high severity violations,â€™ relying on users to report other violations.â€
It was also announced that Facebook will move its trust and safety and content moderation team from California to Texas.
This news comes amid a series of legal issues Meta and Zuckerberg have been facing. In 2024, Meta was found to owe Irelandâ€™s Data Protection Commission over $100 million for neglecting to protect the privacy and passwords of users in a 2019 data breach.
READ MORE: META FACES MASSIVE FINE FOR PRIVACY VIOLATION
In a collection of 25 lawsuits holding Meta accountable for causing social media addiction in children, Zuckerberg was not found personally liable. However, the people behind the filings plan to continue fighting the company. READ MORE: IS META CEO MARK ZUCKERBERG LIABLE FOR CAUSING SOCIAL MEDIA ADDICTION?
